building_blocks.name: Request URL Editor
building_blocks.about: Having full control to edit any part of the URL for any request being made through the client.
building_blocks.category_about: What tooling and services are available, which allow API consumers to make requests, manage the details of these requests, and be as efficient as possible when it comes to editing API requests.

building_blocks.name: Request Headers Editor
building_blocks.about: Being able to add, edit, and remove any headers that will be sent with any request being made through the client.
building_blocks.category_about: What tooling and services are available, which allow API consumers to make requests, manage the details of these requests, and be as efficient as possible when it comes to editing API requests.

building_blocks.name: Cookies Manager
building_blocks.about: Being able create, edit, and remove cookies that control any session of a request being made through the client.
building_blocks.category_about: What tooling and services are available, which allow API consumers to make requests, manage the details of these requests, and be as efficient as possible when it comes to editing API requests.

building_blocks.name: Request Method Manager
building_blocks.about: Allowing for the use of all HTTP verbs, identify each method that is being made as part of a request through the client.
building_blocks.category_about: What tooling and services are available, which allow API consumers to make requests, manage the details of these requests, and be as efficient as possible when it comes to editing API requests.

building_blocks.name: Request Body Editor
building_blocks.about: The ability to add, edit, or remove the entire body of a request being made through the client.
building_blocks.category_about: What tooling and services are available, which allow API consumers to make requests, manage the details of these requests, and be as efficient as possible when it comes to editing API requests.

building_blocks.name: Basic Auth
building_blocks.about: Basic Auth is supported by an HTTP client for authentication as part of ay request being made.
building_blocks.category_about: What are some of the common authentication methods available?

building_blocks.name: Digest Auth
building_blocks.about: Digest Auth is supported by an HTTP client for authentication as part of ay request being made.
building_blocks.category_about: What are some of the common authentication methods available?

building_blocks.name: OAuth 1.0
building_blocks.about: OAuth 1.0a is supported by an HTTP client for authentication as part of ay request being made.
building_blocks.category_about: What are some of the common authentication methods available?

building_blocks.name: OAuth 2.0
building_blocks.about: OAuth 2.0 is supported by an HTTP client for authentication as part of ay request being made.
building_blocks.category_about: What are some of the common authentication methods available?

building_blocks.name: Separate Environments
building_blocks.about: The HTTP client allows for establishing of separate environments to make requests to APIs in different modes.
building_blocks.category_about: What environments are available for isolation API integration within? Is there the ability to setup, maintain, and evolve environment meta information, and variables to support many different APIs.

building_blocks.name: Saved Variables
building_blocks.about: Allow for naming and saving of variables that can be used across API requests, in separate environments.
building_blocks.category_about: What environments are available for isolation API integration within? Is there the ability to setup, maintain, and evolve environment meta information, and variables to support many different APIs.

building_blocks.name: Save Requests
building_blocks.about: Allow individual requests to be saved, and run again in the future with the saved configuration.
building_blocks.category_about: Am I given the ability to view responses, in different ways, as I make requests, and other aspects of API integration.

building_blocks.name: XML Viewer
building_blocks.about: Provide a viewer for seeing the XML returned, and be able to copy, paste, save, and other features.
building_blocks.category_about: Am I given the ability to view responses, in different ways, as I make requests, and other aspects of API integration.

building_blocks.name: JSON Viewer
building_blocks.about: Provide a viewer for seeing the JSON returned, and be able to copy, paste, save, and other features.
building_blocks.category_about: Am I given the ability to view responses, in different ways, as I make requests, and other aspects of API integration.

building_blocks.name: RAW Viewer
building_blocks.about: Provide a viewer for seeing the raw response returned, and be able to copy, paste, save, and other features.
building_blocks.category_about: Am I given the ability to view responses, in different ways, as I make requests, and other aspects of API integration.

building_blocks.name: Search
building_blocks.about: Allow the searching of results, by keyword and key phase, returning the point in results that match search.
building_blocks.category_about: Am I given the ability to view responses, in different ways, as I make requests, and other aspects of API integration.

building_blocks.name: Collections
building_blocks.about: Allow for requests to be saved, and stored into collections that can be named, organized and managed in meaningful groups.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Templates
building_blocks.about: Provide starter templates of common public APIs, allowing HTTP client to be immediately put to use from common definitions.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Clone Requests
building_blocks.about: Enable the HTTP client to clone existing requests, and generate new collections or requests from existing definitions.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Record
building_blocks.about: Allow for any saved request to be recorded, for playback later.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Replay
building_blocks.about: Allow for the replay of any saved requests that has been run and recorded.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Keyboard Shortcuts
building_blocks.about: Provide keyboard shortcuts, that make working with HTTP client requests easier.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: History
building_blocks.about: Provide a historical listing of API requests that have been made, allowing the history to be searched, reviewed, and managed.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Teams
building_blocks.about: Provide team environments, allowing users to collaborate, share and work across API requests, and collections.
building_blocks.category_about: How am I able to organize API calls within my API client tooling and services. Can I organize them into folders, groups, or any other approach.

building_blocks.name: Import Swagger
building_blocks.about: Allow for the importing of API requests using the Swagger API definition format.
building_blocks.category_about: Import and export of common API definitions is becoming more common place in almost every area of the API life cycle. There are the common ones being employe today.

building_blocks.name: Import API Blueprint
building_blocks.about: Allow for the importing of API requests using the API Blueprint API definition format.
building_blocks.category_about: Import and export of common API definitions is becoming more common place in almost every area of the API life cycle. There are the common ones being employe today.

building_blocks.name: Import RAML
building_blocks.about: Allow for the importing of API requests using the RAML API definition format.
building_blocks.category_about: Import and export of common API definitions is becoming more common place in almost every area of the API life cycle. There are the common ones being employe today.

building_blocks.name: Import Postman
building_blocks.about: Allow for the importing of API requests using the Postman API definition format.

building_blocks.name: Export Swagger
building_blocks.about: Allow for the exporting of API requests using the Swagger API definition format.
building_blocks.category_about: Import and export of common API definitions is becoming more common place in almost every area of the API life cycle. There are the common ones being employe today.

building_blocks.name: Export API Blueprint
building_blocks.about: Allow for the exporting of API requests using the API Blueprint API definition format.
building_blocks.category_about: Import and export of common API definitions is becoming more common place in almost every area of the API life cycle. There are the common ones being employe today.

building_blocks.name: Export RAML

building_blocks.name: Command Line
building_blocks.about: Provide a command line interface for developers to use along with an HTTP client.
building_blocks.category_about: What other tooling is available, to make API integration, and clients more effective, and usable by API developers.  Some of these areas may touch on other stops along the API life cycle.

building_blocks.name: Codegen
building_blocks.about: Enable the generation of client code samples from API definitions within the HTTP client.
building_blocks.category_about: What other tooling is available, to make API integration, and clients more effective, and usable by API developers.  Some of these areas may touch on other stops along the API life cycle.

building_blocks.name: Proxy
building_blocks.about: Provide a proxy that can be used when making requests via the HTTP client.
building_blocks.category_about: What other tooling is available, to make API integration, and clients more effective, and usable by API developers.  Some of these areas may touch on other stops along the API life cycle.

building_blocks.name: Extensions
building_blocks.about: Allowing the extension of an HTTP client using a standardize plugin interface.
building_blocks.category_about: What other tooling is available, to make API integration, and clients more effective, and usable by API developers.  Some of these areas may touch on other stops along the API life cycle.
